I don't believe this is the cause of the crash you're seeing. It's simply a warning to the developer that the help table of contents xml file referenced from the plug-in manifest could not be found.

Are there any other exceptions in the log? Was a core dump produced by the JVM? Which JVM are you using?
i am using jrockit 1.6, i do think it is not the main reason, but this is the latest exception in my log before crash.
Can you attach the java core dump file?

Created an attachment (id=75135)
eclipse log

the attached is my eclipse log for these two days, please refer. hope can help
Actually I meant the java core dump, not the eclipse log. It should have been produced when the JVM crashed.

I agree with Curtis that the error in the log is most likely unrelated to the cause of the crash but it may be a symptom of an incomplete installation. I'm not sure how best to debug this but here are a few questions:

What if anything do you see before the crash - does the workbench start to draw?
Have you been able to run earlier versions of Eclipse on this machine?
Apart from the Eclipse SDK what other plugins do you have installed?
Do you see the same crash if you start with a clean configuration and workspace?
